item.title: ArangoDB Starter Options
item.description: Common options --starter.data-dir=path path is the directory in which all data is stored. (default “./”) In the directory, a setup.json file is created, which is used for restarts, as well as a directory for each instance that runs on this machine. Different instances of arangodb must use different data directories. --starter.join=address Join a cluster with the leader (master) Starter at address address (default “”). You can also point to any other Starter that is connected to the initial Starter.

item.title: Security
item.description: Creating certificates The starter provides commands to create all certificates needed for an ArangoDB deployment. TLS server certificates To create a certificate used for TLS servers in the keyfile format, you need the public key of the CA (--cacert), the private key of the CA (--cakey) and one or more hostnames (or IP addresses). Then run: arangodb create tls keyfile \ --cacert=my-tls-ca.crt --cakey=my-tls-ca.key \ --host=<hostname> \ --keyfile=my-tls-cert.keyfile Make sure to store the generated keyfile (my-tls-cert.

item.title: ArangoDB Starter Architecture
item.description: What does the Starter do The ArangoDB Starter is a program used to create ArangoDB database deployments on bare-metal (or virtual machines) with ease. It enables you to create everything from a simple Single server instance to a full blown Cluster in under 5 minutes. The Starter is intended to be used in environments where there is no higher level orchestration system (e.g. Kubernetes) available. Starter versions The Starter is a separate process in a binary called arangodb.
